definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: A: I heard you had great seats for the Three Tenors concert in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我听说你买到了世界三大男高音北京演唱会的好票。

sentences.english: Soprano, alto, tenor and bass constitute the four vocal parts.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

sentences.english: That opera tenor can no loger hit the high notes as he used to.
sentences.chinese: 那位歌剧男高音已不能像以前那样唱高音了。

sentences.english: Goodwife asks famous tenor singer Simier sings a lyric song.
sentences.chinese: 女主人请闻名男高音歌唱家斯米尔唱一首抒情歌曲。

sentences.english: Although he is visually impaired, he did not abandon his dream of becoming a tenor.
sentences.chinese: 视障的他并没有因此就放弃成为男高音的梦想。

sentences.english: There are three of them, the Three Tenors.
sentences.chinese: 由三个呢，世界三大男高音。

sentences.english: The tenor was singing the "toreador song" from carmen.
sentences.chinese: 男高音歌手正在唱《卡门》中的“斗牛士之歌”。

sentences.english: The tenor was lionized in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 这位男高音被奉为名人。

sentences.english: It is a combination of the tenor and the alto.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

sentences.english: The hoarse tenor singer mucked up the recital.
sentences.chinese: 沙哑的男高音把音乐会搞砸了。

sentences.english: The tenor was a pupil of a singer.
sentences.chinese: 这位男高音歌手师承一位歌唱家。

sentences.english: SO YOU WANT TO BE A POP TENOR?
sentences.chinese: 所以你想成为一位流行男高音吗？

definition: double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
